New Records: Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller set a record 79-run fifth-wicket stand for South Africa in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Tanzim Hasan took 3 wickets for 18 runs.
Taskin Ahmed took 2 wickets for 19 runs.
Keshav Maharaj took 3 wickets for 27 runs.
Anrich Nortje took 2 wickets for 17 runs.
Kagiso Rabada took 2 wickets for 19 runs.
Mahmudullah and Towhid Hridoy put on a 44-run partnership for the fifth wicket.
Mahmudullah was controversially given out, negating four leg byes that could have forced a Super Over.
Keshav Maharaj bowled the final over for the first time in T20Is and took two wickets.
David Miller was dropped on 13 and went on to score 29 runs.
Kagiso Rabada bowled a crucial 18th over, conceding only one run.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa chose to bat first on a used wicket at Eisenhower Park.
South Africa aimed to maintain their 100% win-record at the T20 World Cup 2024.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa leave the USA with three wins from three matches and are in pole position to qualify for the Super 8s.
Bangladesh will play Netherlands and Nepal in the West Indies with the Super 8s still in sight.
Concerns were raised about South Africa's top three batters underperforming.
Reeza Hendricks' performance was highlighted as a concern due to his low scores and technical deficiencies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held in New York at Eisenhower Park.
South Africa's top three batters have collectively scored 61 runs in nine trips to the crease at an average of 6.77.
South Africa have only lost their first four wickets by end of the fifth over on five occasions in men's T20Is, and two of them came in this competition.
David Miller celebrated his 35th birthday during the match.
